page.title: 20A GENERAL SUMMARY OF BLOCK.
page.content: Ww have all seen many changes and it is interesting to speculate on what the future holds.The area remains unspoilt although with changes in farming methods,there have been some changes in the environment.Intensive land management and farm mechanisation have resulted in farms being less labour intensive,leading to a decline in population.The Forestry Commission do not employ large numbers now.Communications are by road,post and telephone.The small school is retained.St.Nicxolas' Church serves the Parish of Nicholforest.Community spirit is good,friendly and helpful.People move into the district from both sides of the Border.Work is taken outside area unless of farming stock.A few trades in area.This contribution has come from Warwicksland,a small part of Penton.
